intro: Draba cognata, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, with a bell-shaped appearance, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Draba cognata is often found in high-altitude areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
